alert.note: Alert for Butte (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 10:55AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Big Lost River near Arco affecting Butte County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and releases from Mackay Reservoir continues. * WHERE...Big Lost River near Arco. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, the Big Lost River is near bankfull to bankfull in many locations between Darlington/Moore areas to the INL Complex boundary. Some minor lowland flooding may occur and see ponding. Isolated erosion possible along James Creek south of the Moore bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Forecast...The potential for minor flooding remains possible for the next few days. Levels may change based on any delayed runoff in the area or change in releases from Mackay Reservoir. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Big Lost River Arco 6.5 4.8 Wed 9 am MDT MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
